byline.original: By AL BAKER and BENJAMIN MUELLER

lead_paragraph: Bruce Purdy was shot in the back in the South Bronx last year, leaving him paralyzed from the waist down. He wanted revenge, but instead wound up being added to the 40th Precinct’s 2016 murder tally.

headline.print_headline: A Shooting, the Hospital and Then, Months Later, a Homicide
headline.main: A Shooting, the Hospital and Then, Months Later, It’s a Homicide

snippet: Bruce Purdy was shot in the back in the South Bronx last year, leaving him paralyzed from the waist down. He wanted revenge, but instead wound up being added to the 40th Precinct’s 2016 murder tally.
abstract: Death of Bruce Purdy, South Bronx man paralyzed by gunshot wound who later died of related blood clot, illustrates poverty and violence of  neighborhood, as well as failures of overburdened local health system; Purdy died at Lincoln Medical and Mental Health Center, where most gunshot victims in 40th Precinct are taken; link between gunshot and clot make Purdy's death fourth homicide of 2016 in precinct (Series: Murder in the 4-0).
